sonusSs7ServicesMIB.name: sonusSs7ServicesMIB
sonusSs7ServicesMIB.contactinfo: Customer Support Sonus Networks, Inc, 5 carlisle Road Westford, MA 01886 USA Tel: 978-692-8999 Fax: 978-392-9118 E-mail: cs.snmp@sonusnet.com
sonusSs7ServicesMIB.description: The MIB Module for SS7 Gateway and SS7 Node Configuration.

SonusSs7GatewayLinkSelection.name: SonusSs7GatewayLinkSelection
SonusSs7GatewayLinkSelection.description: The SS7 Gateway link selection value.

sonusSs7GatewayNextIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayNextIndex
sonusSs7GatewayNextIndex.description: The next valid index to use when creating an entry in the sonusSs7GatewayTable.

sonusSs7GatewayTable.name: sonusSs7GatewayTable
sonusSs7GatewayTable.description: This table specifies the SS7 Gateway list for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7GatewayIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayIndex
sonusSs7GatewayIndex.description: Identifies the target SS7 Gateway entry.

sonusSs7GatewayState.name: sonusSs7GatewayState
sonusSs7GatewayState.description: The administrative state of this SS7 Gateway entry.

sonusSs7GatewayName.name: sonusSs7GatewayName
sonusSs7GatewayName.description: The name of this SS7 Gateway instance.

sonusSs7GatewaySocketType.name: sonusSs7GatewaySocketType
sonusSs7GatewaySocketType.description: Indicates the type of socket interface used by the GSX9000 node for connections to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayActiveHost.name: sonusSs7GatewayActiveHost
sonusSs7GatewayActiveHost.description: This status value has been replaced by sonusSs7GatewayNextHost and sonusSs7GatewaySelectHost.

sonusSs7GatewayPriHostName.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriHostName
sonusSs7GatewayPriHostName.description: The host name of the primary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayPriHostIpaddr.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriHostIpaddr
sonusSs7GatewayPriHostIpaddr.description: Specifies the IP Address of the primary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayPriHostMode.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriHostMode
sonusSs7GatewayPriHostMode.description: Specifies the service mode of the primary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayPriHostOosDelayTimer.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriHostOosDelayTimer
sonusSs7GatewayPriHostOosDelayTimer.description: This element is used to delay the action of taking the primary host link out of service for a specified number of minutes.

sonusSs7GatewaySecHostName.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecHostName
sonusSs7GatewaySecHostName.description: The host name of the secondary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewaySecHostIpaddr.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecHostIpaddr
sonusSs7GatewaySecHostIpaddr.description: Specifies the IP Address of the secondary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewaySecHostMode.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecHostMode
sonusSs7GatewaySecHostMode.description: Specifies the service mode of the secondary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewaySecHostOosDelayTimer.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecHostOosDelayTimer
sonusSs7GatewaySecHostOosDelayTimer.description: This element is used to delay the action of taking the secondary host link out of service for a specified number of minutes.

sonusSs7GatewayPriAltHostIpaddr.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriAltHostIpaddr
sonusSs7GatewayPriAltHostIpaddr.description: Specifies the alternate IP Address of the primary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewaySecAltHostIpaddr.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecAltHostIpaddr
sonusSs7GatewaySecAltHostIpaddr.description: Specifies the alternate IP Address of the secondary link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayGwType.name: sonusSs7GatewayGwType
sonusSs7GatewayGwType.description: Gateway type is identified by the gateway protocol it uses

sonusSs7GatewayServerTcpPort.name: sonusSs7GatewayServerTcpPort
sonusSs7GatewayServerTcpPort.description: TCP port for the server of TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewayClientTcpPort.name: sonusSs7GatewayClientTcpPort
sonusSs7GatewayClientTcpPort.description: TCP port for the client of TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliTrafficControl.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliTrafficControl
sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliTrafficControl.description: Control the ss7 traffic on the primary TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliTrafficControl.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliTrafficControl
sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliTrafficControl.description: Control the ss7 traffic on the primary TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliTrafficControl.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliTrafficControl
sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliTrafficControl.description: Control the ss7 traffic on the secondary TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliTrafficControl.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliTrafficControl
sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliTrafficControl.description: Control the ss7 traffic on the secondary TALI connection

sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT1.name: sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT1
sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT1.description: Send a TALI-TEST upon the expiry of T1 in millisecond.

sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT2.name: sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT2
sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT2.description: Guard timer in millisecond for the return of TALI-ALLO or TALI-PROH in response to a TALI-TEST sent earlier.

sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT3.name: sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT3
sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT3.description: T3 in millisecond reprsents how long the near end can continue to process received messages after sending TALI-PROH.

sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT4.name: sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT4
sonusSs7GatewayTimerTaliT4.description: Send a TALI-MONI upon the expiry of T4 in millisecond.

sonusSs7GatewayTaliSs7Type.name: sonusSs7GatewayTaliSs7Type
sonusSs7GatewayTaliSs7Type.description: SS7 protocol types used over TALI

sonusSs7GatewaySlsBits.name: sonusSs7GatewaySlsBits
sonusSs7GatewaySlsBits.description: The number of SLS bits to use

sonusSs7GatewayTaliIsupNormalization.name: sonusSs7GatewayTaliIsupNormalization
sonusSs7GatewayTaliIsupNormalization.description: ISUP message format over TALI -- normalized or raw

sonusSs7GatewayStatusTable.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusTable
sonusSs7GatewayStatusTable.description: Status Table of the SS7 Gateway for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusEntry.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusEntry
sonusSs7GatewayStatusEntry.description: List of SS7 Gateway status elements.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusIndex
sonusSs7GatewayStatusIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway status entry.

sonusSs7GatewayNextHost.name: sonusSs7GatewayNextHost
sonusSs7GatewayNextHost.description: Indicates which host link connection to the SS7 Gateway is next to be selected. If there is none, then this element is set to none.

sonusSs7GatewaySelectHost.name: sonusSs7GatewaySelectHost
sonusSs7GatewaySelectHost.description: Indicates which host link connection to the SS7 Gateway is selected to be tried. If there is none, then this element is set to none.

sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliConnState.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliConnState
sonusSs7GatewayPriTaliConnState.description: TALI state of the primary connection for this SS7 gateway.

sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliConnState.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliConnState
sonusSs7GatewaySecTaliConnState.description: TALI state of the secondary connection for this SS7 gateway.

sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliConnState.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliConnState
sonusSs7GatewayPriAltTaliConnState.description: TALI state of the primary alt connection for this SS7 gateway.

sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliConnState.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliConnState
sonusSs7GatewaySecAltTaliConnState.description: TALI state of the secondary alt connection for this SS7 gateway.

sonusSs7GatewayPriNearEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriNearEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewayPriNearEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the near end of the pri conncection

sonusSs7GatewayPriFarEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriFarEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewayPriFarEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the far end of the pri connection

sonusSs7GatewayPriAltNearEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriAltNearEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewayPriAltNearEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the near end of the pri-alt conn.

sonusSs7GatewayPriAltFarEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewayPriAltFarEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewayPriAltFarEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the far end of the pri-alt connection

sonusSs7GatewaySecNearEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecNearEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewaySecNearEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the near end of the sec conncection

sonusSs7GatewaySecFarEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecFarEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewaySecFarEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the far end of the sec connection

sonusSs7GatewaySecAltNearEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecAltNearEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewaySecAltNearEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the near end of the sec-alt conn.

sonusSs7GatewaySecAltFarEndTaliVersion.name: sonusSs7GatewaySecAltFarEndTaliVersion
sonusSs7GatewaySecAltFarEndTaliVersion.description: TALI protocol version at the far end of the sec-alt connection

sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusTable.name: sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusTable
sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusTable.description: Status Table of the SS7 Gateway of a PRIMARY or SECONDARY for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusEntry.name: sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusEntry
sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusEntry.description: List of SS7 Gateway status elements.

sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusIndex
sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway status entry.

sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPSIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPSIndex
sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPSIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway link status entry.

sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPrimaryCE.name: sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPrimaryCE
sonusSs7GatewayPSStatusPrimaryCE.description: Identifies the link Primary CE value.

sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusTable.name: sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusTable
sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusTable.description: Link Status Table of a SS7 Gateway for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusEntry.name: sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusEntry
sonusSs7GatewayLinkStatusEntry.description: List of SS7 Gateway Link Status elements.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkIndex
sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway status link entry gateway index.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkPSIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkPSIndex
sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkPSIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway status link entry primary or secondary index.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkHostIndex.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkHostIndex
sonusSs7GatewayStatusLinkHostIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Gateway host status link entry index.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostName.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostName
sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostName.description: The host name of the Link link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostIpaddr.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostIpaddr
sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostIpaddr.description: Specifies the IP Address of the link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostState.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostState
sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostState.description: The state of host link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostCE.name: sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostCE
sonusSs7GatewayStatusHostCE.description: The CE of host link to the SS7 Gateway platform.

sonusSs7NodeStatusTable.name: sonusSs7NodeStatusTable
sonusSs7NodeStatusTable.description: Status Table of the SS7 Node for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7NodeStatusEntry.name: sonusSs7NodeStatusEntry
sonusSs7NodeStatusEntry.description: List of SS7 Node status elements.

sonusSs7NodeStatusIndex.name: sonusSs7NodeStatusIndex
sonusSs7NodeStatusIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Node status entry.

sonusSs7NodeStatIsup.name: sonusSs7NodeStatIsup
sonusSs7NodeStatIsup.description: Specifies the operating status of the ISUP service within this SS7 Node.

sonusSs7NodeStatMtp.name: sonusSs7NodeStatMtp
sonusSs7NodeStatMtp.description: Specifies the current MTP status for this SS7 Node.

sonusSs7NodeNextIndex.name: sonusSs7NodeNextIndex
sonusSs7NodeNextIndex.description: The next valid index to use when creating an entry in the sonusSs7NodeTable.

sonusSs7NodeTable.name: sonusSs7NodeTable
sonusSs7NodeTable.description: This table specifies the SS7 Node list for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7NodeIndex.name: sonusSs7NodeIndex
sonusSs7NodeIndex.description: Identifies the target SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7NodeState.name: sonusSs7NodeState
sonusSs7NodeState.description: The administrative state of this SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7NodeName.name: sonusSs7NodeName
sonusSs7NodeName.description: The name of this SS7 Node instance.

sonusSs7NodePointCode.name: sonusSs7NodePointCode
sonusSs7NodePointCode.description: The SS7 point code assigned to this SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7NodeServices.name: sonusSs7NodeServices
sonusSs7NodeServices.description: The type of SS7 services (ISUP, TCAP, or both) supported by this SS7 Node entry. As of GSX release 3.02.00, isupOnly is now the only vaild option for this entry.

sonusSs7NodeProtocol.name: sonusSs7NodeProtocol
sonusSs7NodeProtocol.description: The SS7 protocol type supported by this SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7NodeTcapSsn.name: sonusSs7NodeTcapSsn
sonusSs7NodeTcapSsn.description: If Tcap is supported by this SS7 Node, specifies the Sub System Number for this node entry. This object is obsoleted as of GSX release 3.02.00.

sonusSs7NodeIsupStatus.name: sonusSs7NodeIsupStatus
sonusSs7NodeIsupStatus.description: This status value has been replaced by sonusSs7NodeStatIsup

sonusSs7NodeTcapStatus.name: sonusSs7NodeTcapStatus
sonusSs7NodeTcapStatus.description: Specifies the operating status of the TCAP service within this SS7 Node. This object is obsoleted as of GSX release 3.02.00.

sonusSs7NodeMtpStatus.name: sonusSs7NodeMtpStatus
sonusSs7NodeMtpStatus.description: This status value has been replaced by sonusSs7NodeStatMtp

sonusSs7NodeGatewayAssignment.name: sonusSs7NodeGatewayAssignment
sonusSs7NodeGatewayAssignment.description: The name of the SS7 Gateway to which this SS7 Node is assigned.

sonusSs7NodeNativePointCode.name: sonusSs7NodeNativePointCode
sonusSs7NodeNativePointCode.description: The native point code of the SS7 node. e.g. For ITU the point code is in 3 bit 8 bit 3 bit format adding up to 14 bits whereas ANSI uses a 8bit 8bit 8bit format adding up to 24 bits.

sonusSs7NodeMode.name: sonusSs7NodeMode
sonusSs7NodeMode.description: Specifies the service mode for this SS7 Node.

sonusSs7NodeConnCntrl.name: sonusSs7NodeConnCntrl
sonusSs7NodeConnCntrl.description: Specifies when the Node will establish an ISUP connection with the SS7 Gateway. This parameter is used to minimize unnecessary connections to the SS7 Gateway for ISUP services, allowing the GSX to only establish the ISUP connections that are required by ISUP circuits on a particular shelf. When set to always, the ISUP service connection will be established when the node is enabled. When set to asNeeded, the ISUP service connection will be established only if there are ISUP circuits assigned to this node. This parameter only applies to ISUP service registration.

sonusSs7NodeStdPointCode.name: sonusSs7NodeStdPointCode
sonusSs7NodeStdPointCode.description: Octet string of the point code. This gives the actual representation the user entered.

sonusSs7NodePointCodeSize.name: sonusSs7NodePointCodeSize
sonusSs7NodePointCodeSize.description: Indicates the total number of bits in the point code.

sonusSs7NodePointCodeFormatType.name: sonusSs7NodePointCodeFormatType
sonusSs7NodePointCodeFormatType.description: The Point Code format type being defined.

sonusSs7NodeServerProtocol.name: sonusSs7NodeServerProtocol
sonusSs7NodeServerProtocol.description: The interface used between the SS7 gateway and the SS7 client on the GSX9000

sonusSs7NodeHandShakeInterval.name: sonusSs7NodeHandShakeInterval
sonusSs7NodeHandShakeInterval.description: HandShake interval between the client and the server in seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT1.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT1
sonusSs7NodeTimerT1.description: The Timer T1 could be changed from its default using this entry. The valid ranges are 4 - 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 - 60 Seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT2.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT2
sonusSs7NodeTimerT2.description: The Timer T2 could be changed from its default using this entry. The valid value for ITU is 3 Minutes. This timer has no relevence in the ANSI network.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT3.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT3
sonusSs7NodeTimerT3.description: The T3 timer is started on receipt of an Overload message in the ITU network. This has no relevence in the ANSI network. The valid ITU recommended value is 120 Seconds

sonusSs7NodeTimerT4.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT4
sonusSs7NodeTimerT4.description: The Timer T4 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT5.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT5
sonusSs7NodeTimerT5.description: The T5 Timer is started when the release message is sent. The valid values as per the specifications are 60 seconds for the ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT6.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT6
sonusSs7NodeTimerT6.description: The timer T6 is started when the suspend message is received. The valid range for this timer is 1 to 120 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT7.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT7
sonusSs7NodeTimerT7.description: The Timer T7 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT8.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT8
sonusSs7NodeTimerT8.description: The T8 timer is timer to be started with continuity check has been indicated in the IAM. The valid range is 10 to 15 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT9.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT9
sonusSs7NodeTimerT9.description: The Timer T9 started when outgoing international exchange recieves an ACM. The valid range is 120 to 240 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT10.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT10
sonusSs7NodeTimerT10.description: The Timer T10 is started when the last digit is recived in interworking situations. This timer has no relevence to ANSI.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT11.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT11
sonusSs7NodeTimerT11.description: The Timer T11 is started when the latest address message is received in interworking situations. The valid range is 15 to 20 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT12.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT12
sonusSs7NodeTimerT12.description: The Timer T12 is started when a blocking message is sent. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT13.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT13
sonusSs7NodeTimerT13.description: The Timer T13 is started when the initial blocking messge is sent. The valid value for ANSI is 60 seconds and for ITU is between 300 and 900 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT14.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT14
sonusSs7NodeTimerT14.description: The Timer T14 is started when an unblocking message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU

sonusSs7NodeTimerT15.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT15
sonusSs7NodeTimerT15.description: The Timer T15 is started when the initial unblocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT16.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT16
sonusSs7NodeTimerT16.description: The Timer T16 is started when the reset circuit is started which was not due to expiry of T5. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT17.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT17
sonusSs7NodeTimerT17.description: The Timer T17 is started when initial reset message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT18.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT18
sonusSs7NodeTimerT18.description: The Timer T18 is started when circuit group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT19.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT19
sonusSs7NodeTimerT19.description: The Timer T19 is started when initial group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT20.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT20
sonusSs7NodeTimerT20.description: The Timer T20 is started when group unblocking message is sent. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT21.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT21
sonusSs7NodeTimerT21.description: The Timer T21 is started when initial group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT22.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT22
sonusSs7NodeTimerT22.description: The Timer T22 is started when circuit group reset message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT23.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT23
sonusSs7NodeTimerT23.description: The Timer T23 is started when initial group reset message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for the ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for the ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT24.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT24
sonusSs7NodeTimerT24.description: The Timer T24 is started when check tone is sent. The value is less than 2 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT25.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT25
sonusSs7NodeTimerT25.description: The Timer T25 is started when initial continuity check failure is detected. The range is 1 to 10 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT26.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT26
sonusSs7NodeTimerT26.description: The Timer T26 is started when a second or subsequent continuity failure is detected. The valid value are 60 to 180 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT27.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT27
sonusSs7NodeTimerT27.description: The Timer T27 is started when a continuity fail message is recieved. The valid values are more than 180 seconds for ANSI and 240 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT28.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT28
sonusSs7NodeTimerT28.description: The Timer T28 is started when Circuit Query Message is sent. The valid value is 10 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT29.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT29
sonusSs7NodeTimerT29.description: The Timer T29 is started when Congestion indication is received when T29 is not running. The valid range is 300 to 600 milli second. This timer has no relevence for ANSI.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT30.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT30
sonusSs7NodeTimerT30.description: The Timer T30 is stared when congestion indication is recieved when T29 is not running. The valid range is 5 to 10 seconds for the ITU. This timer has no relevence under ANSI.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT31.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT31
sonusSs7NodeTimerT31.description: The Timer T31 is started on release of ISUP signalling connection based on CO SCCP. The value should be set to greater than 360 seconds

sonusSs7NodeTimerT32.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT32
sonusSs7NodeTimerT32.description: The Timer T32 is started when the first end-to-end message is recived. Under ANSI this timer is started after the response to such a message is sent. The valid values are 3 to 5 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT33.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT33
sonusSs7NodeTimerT33.description: The Timer T33 is started when Information Request Message is sent. The valid range is 12 to 15 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT34.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT34
sonusSs7NodeTimerT34.description: The Timer T34 is started when Loop Back Acknowledgement is sent under ANSI. The Timer T34 is started when segmentation is received for IAM, ACM, CPG, ANM or CON under ITU. The valid range for ANSI is 10 to 15 seconds. The valid range for ITU is 2 to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT35.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT35
sonusSs7NodeTimerT35.description: The Timer T35 is started when the last digit recieved is not an ST digit or the fixed number of digits have been recieved. This procedure is only valid for overlap hence ITU. This timer has no relevence in ANSI.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT36.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT36
sonusSs7NodeTimerT36.description: The Timer T36 is started when IAM is recived with a segmentation indication for ANSI. This timer is started when transit or incoming international exchange recieves Continuity check request message. The valid range for ANSI is 2 to 4 seconds and 10 to 15 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT37.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT37
sonusSs7NodeTimerT37.description: The Timer T37 is started when User Part Availability test is started under ANSI. This timer is started when a request for and Echo control device is sent to another exchange under ITU. The valid value for ANSI is 30 seconds and for ITU is 2 to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT38.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT38
sonusSs7NodeTimerT38.description: The Timer T38 is started when a suspend message is sent to the preceding switch. This timer is only relevent under ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT39.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT39
sonusSs7NodeTimerT39.description: The Timer T39 is started when MCID request is sent. It is only relevent in the ITU.

sonusSs7NodeTimerT40.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerT40
sonusSs7NodeTimerT40.description: The Timer T40 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTAcc.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTAcc
sonusSs7NodeTimerTAcc.description: Automatic Congestion Control Timer as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995. The value of the timer is 5 Seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcr.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcr
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcr.description: Continuity Check Request Timer. The value As per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 2 Seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcrr.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcrr
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCcrr.description: Continuity Check Failed Recived. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 20 Seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCgb.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCgb
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCgb.description: Timer started on recipt of a Circuit Group Block Message. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 5 Seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCra.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCra
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCra.description: Timer started when Circuit Reservation Acknowledgment is sent. The time value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 20 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCrm.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCrm
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCrm.description: This timer is started when the circuit reservation message is sent. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 3 - 4 Seconds. The default is set to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCvt.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCvt
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCvt.description: The Timer T CVT is started when the Circuit Validation Test message is sent. This message is only valid for ANSI.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTExm.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTExm
sonusSs7NodeTimerTExm.description: The Timer Exm,d is started when IAM is sent to the succeeding network. This timer has no relevence in the ITU. This timer is in milliseconds

sonusSs7NodeTimerTGrs.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTGrs
sonusSs7NodeTimerTGrs.description: This timer is started when a circuit group reset message is received. This timer is only relevent in the ANSI network.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTHga.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTHga
sonusSs7NodeTimerTHga.description: This timer is started on recognition of carrier loss. It is only relevent in ANSI network. The valid range is 0 to 300 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTScga.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTScga
sonusSs7NodeTimerTScga.description: This timer is started when initial demand continuity check fails in the SCGA group. The valid range for this timer is 0 to 120 seconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTScgad.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTScgad
sonusSs7NodeTimerTScgad.description: This timer is started failure of demand continuity check in the SCGA group.

sonusSs7NodeApplProfileName.name: sonusSs7NodeApplProfileName
sonusSs7NodeApplProfileName.description: The SS7 Node Profile to be applied to the node. The values here are a snap shot only and might have changed since they were set.

sonusSs7NodeNetworkInd.name: sonusSs7NodeNetworkInd
sonusSs7NodeNetworkInd.description: The setting of the Network Indicator used for this SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7NodeSlsBits.name: sonusSs7NodeSlsBits
sonusSs7NodeSlsBits.description: The number of SLS bits to use

sonusSs7NodeTimerTA.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTA
sonusSs7NodeTimerTA.description: The Bellcore specific timer TA is the guard timer on outgoing SS7 circuit before idling. The value of this timer is 0 to 1000 milliseconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTBlom.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTBlom
sonusSs7NodeTimerTBlom.description: The Bellcore specific timer TBlom is started when blocking a circuit due to a BLO, and after any call is released; used to notify maintenance.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotd.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotd
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotd.description: The Bellcore specific timer TCOTd is started when sending IAM requesting continuity check. The value of this timer is in milliseconds.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotl.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotl
sonusSs7NodeTimerTCotl.description: The Bellcore specific timer TCOTl is started when receiving second COT coded failed, awaiting receipt of CCR.

sonusSs7NodeTimerTSus.name: sonusSs7NodeTimerTSus
sonusSs7NodeTimerTSus.description: The Bellcore specific timer TSUS is started when a SUS message is sent by the terminating switch, awaiting called party off-hook or REL.

sonusSs7NodeProfileNextIndex.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileNextIndex
sonusSs7NodeProfileNextIndex.description: The next valid index to use when creating an entry in the sonusSs7NodeProfileTable.

sonusSs7NodeProfileTable.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileTable
sonusSs7NodeProfileTable.description: This table specifies the SS7 Node Profile list for the GSX9000 node.

sonusSs7NodeProfileIndex.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileIndex
sonusSs7NodeProfileIndex.description: Identifies the SS7 Node Profile entry

sonusSs7NodeProfileName.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileName
sonusSs7NodeProfileName.description: The name of the Node Profile

sonusSs7PointCodeSize.name: sonusSs7PointCodeSize
sonusSs7PointCodeSize.description: Indicates the total number of bits in the point code.

sonusSs7PointCodeFormatType.name: sonusSs7PointCodeFormatType
sonusSs7PointCodeFormatType.description: The Point Code format type being defined.

sonusSs7ServerProtocol.name: sonusSs7ServerProtocol
sonusSs7ServerProtocol.description: The interface used between the SS7 gateway and the SS7 client on the GSX9000

sonusSs7HandShakeInterval.name: sonusSs7HandShakeInterval
sonusSs7HandShakeInterval.description: HandShake interval between the client and the server in seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT1.name: sonusSs7TimerT1
sonusSs7TimerT1.description: The Timer T1 could be changed from its default using this entry. The valid ranges are 4 - 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 - 60 Seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT2.name: sonusSs7TimerT2
sonusSs7TimerT2.description: The Timer T2 could be changed from its default using this entry. The valid value for ITU is 3 Minutes. This timer has no relevence in the ANSI network.

sonusSs7TimerT3.name: sonusSs7TimerT3
sonusSs7TimerT3.description: The T3 timer is started on receipt of an Overload message in the ITU network. This has no relevence in the ANSI network. The valid ITU recommended value is 120 Seconds

sonusSs7TimerT4.name: sonusSs7TimerT4
sonusSs7TimerT4.description: The Timer T4 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7TimerT5.name: sonusSs7TimerT5
sonusSs7TimerT5.description: The T5 Timer is started when the release message is sent. The valid values as per the specifications are 60 seconds for the ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT6.name: sonusSs7TimerT6
sonusSs7TimerT6.description: The timer T6 is started when the suspend message is received. The valid range for this timer is 10 to 32 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT7.name: sonusSs7TimerT7
sonusSs7TimerT7.description: The Timer T7 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7TimerT8.name: sonusSs7TimerT8
sonusSs7TimerT8.description: The T8 timer is timer to be started with continuity check has been indicated in the IAM. The valid range is 10 to 15 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT9.name: sonusSs7TimerT9
sonusSs7TimerT9.description: The Timer T9 started when outgoing international exchange recieves an ACM. The valid range is 120 to 240 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT10.name: sonusSs7TimerT10
sonusSs7TimerT10.description: The Timer T10 is started when the last digit is recived in interworking situations. This timer has no relevence to ANSI.

sonusSs7TimerT11.name: sonusSs7TimerT11
sonusSs7TimerT11.description: The Timer T11 is started when the latest address message is received in interworking situations. The valid range is 15 to 20 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT12.name: sonusSs7TimerT12
sonusSs7TimerT12.description: The Timer T12 is started when a blocking message is sent. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT13.name: sonusSs7TimerT13
sonusSs7TimerT13.description: The Timer T13 is started when the initial blocking messge is sent. The valid value for ANSI is 60 seconds and for ITU is between 300 and 900 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT14.name: sonusSs7TimerT14
sonusSs7TimerT14.description: The Timer T14 is started when an unblocking message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU

sonusSs7TimerT15.name: sonusSs7TimerT15
sonusSs7TimerT15.description: The Timer T15 is started when the initial unblocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT16.name: sonusSs7TimerT16
sonusSs7TimerT16.description: The Timer T16 is started when the reset circuit is started which was not due to expiry of T5. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT17.name: sonusSs7TimerT17
sonusSs7TimerT17.description: The Timer T17 is started when initial reset message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT18.name: sonusSs7TimerT18
sonusSs7TimerT18.description: The Timer T18 is started when circuit group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT19.name: sonusSs7TimerT19
sonusSs7TimerT19.description: The Timer T19 is started when initial group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT20.name: sonusSs7TimerT20
sonusSs7TimerT20.description: The Timer T20 is started when group unblocking message is sent. The valid ranges are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT21.name: sonusSs7TimerT21
sonusSs7TimerT21.description: The Timer T21 is started when initial group blocking message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT22.name: sonusSs7TimerT22
sonusSs7TimerT22.description: The Timer T22 is started when circuit group reset message is sent. The valid values are 4 to 15 seconds for ANSI and 15 to 60 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT23.name: sonusSs7TimerT23
sonusSs7TimerT23.description: The Timer T23 is started when initial group reset message is sent. The valid values are 60 seconds for the ANSI and 300 to 900 seconds for the ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT24.name: sonusSs7TimerT24
sonusSs7TimerT24.description: The Timer T24 is started when check tone is sent. The value is less than 2 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT25.name: sonusSs7TimerT25
sonusSs7TimerT25.description: The Timer T25 is started when initial continuity check failure is detected. The range is 1 to 10 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT26.name: sonusSs7TimerT26
sonusSs7TimerT26.description: The Timer T26 is started when a second or subsequent continuity failure is detected. The valid value are 60 to 180 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT27.name: sonusSs7TimerT27
sonusSs7TimerT27.description: The Timer T27 is started when a continuity fail message is recieved. The valid values are more than 180 seconds for ANSI and 240 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT28.name: sonusSs7TimerT28
sonusSs7TimerT28.description: The Timer T28 is started when Circuit Query Message is sent. The valid value is 10 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT29.name: sonusSs7TimerT29
sonusSs7TimerT29.description: The Timer T29 is started when Congestion indication is received when T29 is not running. The valid range is 300 to 600 milli second. This timer has no relevence for ANSI.

sonusSs7TimerT30.name: sonusSs7TimerT30
sonusSs7TimerT30.description: The Timer T30 is stared when congestion indication is recieved when T29 is not running. The valid range is 5 to 10 seconds for the ITU. This timer has no relevence under ANSI.

sonusSs7TimerT31.name: sonusSs7TimerT31
sonusSs7TimerT31.description: The Timer T31 is started on release of ISUP signalling connection based on CO SCCP. The value should be set to greater than 360 seconds

sonusSs7TimerT32.name: sonusSs7TimerT32
sonusSs7TimerT32.description: The Timer T32 is started when the first end-to-end message is recived. Under ANSI this timer is started after the response to such a message is sent. The valid values are 3 to 5 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT33.name: sonusSs7TimerT33
sonusSs7TimerT33.description: The Timer T33 is started when Information Request Message is sent. The valid range is 12 to 15 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT34.name: sonusSs7TimerT34
sonusSs7TimerT34.description: The Timer T34 is started when Loop Back Acknowledgement is sent under ANSI. The Timer T34 is started when segmentation is received for IAM, ACM, CPG, ANM or CON under ITU. The valid range for ANSI is 10 to 15 seconds. The valid range for ITU is 2 to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT35.name: sonusSs7TimerT35
sonusSs7TimerT35.description: The Timer T35 is started when the last digit recieved is not an ST digit or the fixed number of digits have been recieved. This procedure is only valid for overlap hence ITU. This timer has no relevence in ANSI.

sonusSs7TimerT36.name: sonusSs7TimerT36
sonusSs7TimerT36.description: The Timer T36 is started when IAM is recived with a segmentation indication for ANSI. This timer is started when transit or incoming international exchange recieves Continuity check request message. The valid range for ANSI is 2 to 4 seconds and 10 to 15 seconds for ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT37.name: sonusSs7TimerT37
sonusSs7TimerT37.description: The Timer T37 is started when User Part Availability test is started under ANSI. This timer is started when a request for and Echo control device is sent to another exchange under ITU. The valid value for ANSI is 30 seconds and for ITU is 2 to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerT38.name: sonusSs7TimerT38
sonusSs7TimerT38.description: The Timer T38 is started when a suspend message is sent to the preceding switch. This timer is only relevent under ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT39.name: sonusSs7TimerT39
sonusSs7TimerT39.description: The Timer T39 is started when MCID request is sent. It is only relevent in the ITU.

sonusSs7TimerT40.name: sonusSs7TimerT40
sonusSs7TimerT40.description: The Timer T40 could be changed from its default using this entry.

sonusSs7TimerTAcc.name: sonusSs7TimerTAcc
sonusSs7TimerTAcc.description: Automatic Congestion Control Timer as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995. The value of the timer is 5 Seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCcr.name: sonusSs7TimerTCcr
sonusSs7TimerTCcr.description: Continuity Check Request Timer. The value As per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 2 Seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCcrr.name: sonusSs7TimerTCcrr
sonusSs7TimerTCcrr.description: Continuity Check Failed Recived. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 20 Seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCgb.name: sonusSs7TimerTCgb
sonusSs7TimerTCgb.description: Timer started on recipt of a Circuit Group Block Message. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 5 Seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCra.name: sonusSs7TimerTCra
sonusSs7TimerTCra.description: Timer started when Circuit Reservation Acknowledgment is sent. The time value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 20 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCrm.name: sonusSs7TimerTCrm
sonusSs7TimerTCrm.description: This timer is started when the circuit reservation message is sent. The value as per ANSI T1.113.4 - 1995 is 3 - 4 Seconds. The default is set to 4 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCvt.name: sonusSs7TimerTCvt
sonusSs7TimerTCvt.description: The Timer T CVT is started when the Circuit Validation Test message is sent. This message is only valid for ANSI.

sonusSs7TimerTExm.name: sonusSs7TimerTExm
sonusSs7TimerTExm.description: The Timer Exm,d is started when IAM is sent to the succeeding network. This timer has no relevence in the ITU. This timer is in milliseconds.

sonusSs7TimerTGrs.name: sonusSs7TimerTGrs
sonusSs7TimerTGrs.description: This timer is started when a circuit group reset message is received. This timer is only relevent in the ANSI network.

sonusSs7TimerTHga.name: sonusSs7TimerTHga
sonusSs7TimerTHga.description: This timer is started on recognition of carrier loss. It is only relevent in ANSI network. The valid range is 0 to 300 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTScga.name: sonusSs7TimerTScga
sonusSs7TimerTScga.description: This timer is started when initial demand continuity check fails in the SCGA group. The valid range for this timer is 0 to 120 seconds.

sonusSs7TimerTScgad.name: sonusSs7TimerTScgad
sonusSs7TimerTScgad.description: This timer is started failure of demand continuity check in the SCGA group.

sonusSs7NodeProfileState.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileState
sonusSs7NodeProfileState.description: The administrative state of this object.

sonusSs7NodeProfileNetworkInd.name: sonusSs7NodeProfileNetworkInd
sonusSs7NodeProfileNetworkInd.description: The setting of the Network Indicator used for this SS7 Node entry.

sonusSs7SlsBits.name: sonusSs7SlsBits
sonusSs7SlsBits.description: The number of SLS bits to use

sonusSs7TimerTA.name: sonusSs7TimerTA
sonusSs7TimerTA.description: The Bellcore specific timer TA is started when a RLC message is sent by the switch. The value of this timer is 0 to 1000 milliseconds.

sonusSs7TimerTBlom.name: sonusSs7TimerTBlom
sonusSs7TimerTBlom.description: The Bellcore specific timer TBlom is started when blocking a circuit due to a BLO, and after any call is released; used to notify maintenance.

sonusSs7TimerTCotd.name: sonusSs7TimerTCotd
sonusSs7TimerTCotd.description: The Bellcore specific timer TCOTd is started when sending IAM requesting continuity check. The value of this timer is in milliseconds.

sonusSs7TimerTCotl.name: sonusSs7TimerTCotl
sonusSs7TimerTCotl.description: The Bellcore specific timer TCOTl is started when receiving second COT coded failed, awaiting receipt of CCR.

sonusSs7TimerTSus.name: sonusSs7TimerTSus
sonusSs7TimerTSus.description: The Bellcore specific timer TSUS is started when a SUS message is sent by the terminating switch, awaiting called party off-hook or REL.

sonusSs7NodeServiceType.name: sonusSs7NodeServiceType
sonusSs7NodeServiceType.description: The type of service supported by this SS7 node connection (ISUP or TCAP).

sonusSs7NodeStateChangeReason.name: sonusSs7NodeStateChangeReason
sonusSs7NodeStateChangeReason.description: The reason why this SS7 node connection has changed state.

sonusSs7NodeCurrentState.name: sonusSs7NodeCurrentState
sonusSs7NodeCurrentState.description: The current state of this SS7 node connection.

sonusSs7NodeAffectedPointCode.name: sonusSs7NodeAffectedPointCode
sonusSs7NodeAffectedPointCode.description: The SS7 point code affected by this MTP state change.

sonusSs7NodeConnectionEstablishedNotific.name: sonusSs7NodeConnectionEstablishedNotification
sonusSs7NodeConnectionEstablishedNotific.description: This trap indicates that a connection has been established to the specified SS7 gateway. Information provided by this trap includes the name of the connected SS7 node, the name of the SS7 gateway on which the node resides, and the type of SS7 service that has been established (ISUP or TCAP).

sonusSs7NodeConnectionFailedNotification.name: sonusSs7NodeConnectionFailedNotification
sonusSs7NodeConnectionFailedNotification.description: This trap indicates that an established connection to an SS7 gateway has failed. Information provided by this trap includes the name of the failed SS7 node, the name of the SS7 gateway on which the node resides, the type of SS7 service affected by this failure, and the reason why the connection has failed.

sonusSs7NodeConnectionStateChangeNotific.name: sonusSs7NodeConnectionStateChangeNotification
sonusSs7NodeConnectionStateChangeNotific.description: This trap indicates that an established connection to an SS7 gateway has changed state. Information provided by this trap includes the name of the affected SS7 node, the name of the SS7 gateway on which the node resides, the type of SS7 service affected by this failure, the new state of the node, and the reason for the state change.

sonusSs7NodeMtpStateChangeNotification.name: sonusSs7NodeMtpStateChangeNotification
sonusSs7NodeMtpStateChangeNotification.description: This trap indicates that a MTP state change event has been received from the SS7 gateway, affecting the specified destination (or remote) point code (DPC). Information provided by this trap includes the name of the affected SS7 node, the name of the SS7 gateway on which the node resides, the updated MTP state, and the DPC affected by this event.
